newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Foreigners hold 10 pct of Israeli shares.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners hold 10 pct of Israeli shares.

text.p: Foreign investors hold about 10 percent of the shares traded on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange, the bourse said.
A survey by the exchange showed that foreigners had holdings worth 7.4 billion shekels in some 130 publicly traded companies, about one-fifth of the total number listed on the bourse.
The exchange said its survey, completed at the end of September, and findings by the central bank at the end of June showed that foreign investors held almost 10 percent of total shares traded.
Foreigners hold a majority stake in 27 publicly traded companies, the bourse said.

Israeli pharmaceutical company Teva led a list of 10 companies in which foreigners held shares worth more than 200 million shekels. Foreign investors have a stake in Teva worth 1.4 billion shekels, the exchange said.
Half of the largest foreign holdings were achieved in the last few years, notably in Israel Chemicals, Koor and Bezeq Israel Telecommunications, as a result of privatisation.
